;据媒体援引不明消息来源报道，乌克兰周二向俄罗斯军队发射了美国提供的远程 ATACMS 导弹据美国有线电视新闻网 (CNN) 援引两名身份不明的美国官员的话报道，美国秘密向基辅提供了这些导弹，但目前还不清楚华盛顿何时发送这些导弹。

;

;据《华尔街日报》报道，ATACMS（陆军战术导弹系统）于周二发射，这是在这场持续约 20 个月的冲突中首次使用。 Politico 还报道了这些导弹的采购和部署情况，据称这些导弹是在最近几周发送的。

;美国国务院表示无法证实这些报道，并将有关军事行动的问题转交给乌克兰政府。

;

;周二美国股市下跌，基准国债收益率飙升，强劲的经济数据和强劲的第三季度盈利似乎使美联储维持限制性政策的时间长于预期。

;

;美国三大股指均走低，对利率敏感的大型股拖累科技股纳斯达克指数跌幅最大。

;

;拜登政府宣布计划;停止向中国运送;更先进的人工智能芯片。

;

;费城SE半导体指数;(.SOX); 最后下跌 1.5%。

;

;共识领先;零售销售;数据，以及来自;美国银行; ; (BAC.N); 和;高盛; ;(GS.N); 增加了越来越多的证据表明尽管央行试图通过提高利率来抑制通货膨胀，但美国经济仍在稳步发展。

;

;“好消息就是坏消息，这是关键，”大通投资顾问总裁彼得·图兹 (Peter Tuz) 表示。弗吉尼亚州夏洛茨维尔。 “零售销售数据很稳定，可能会产生使利率长期保持在较高水平的效果。”

;

;“这可能是当今股市好转的最大因素。”

;

;市场参与者也在关注正在展开的人道主义;危机;美国总统乔·拜登前往该地区，引发以色列与哈马斯冲突。

;

;道琼斯工业平均指数;(.SPX); 下跌 14.97 点，即 0.34%，至 4,358.66 点，纳斯达克综合指数;(.IXIC); 下跌 84.32 点，跌幅 0.62%，至 13,483.67 点。

;

;欧洲股市 ;受一系列悲观盈利和中东冲突引发的地缘政治担忧的拖累，美国开盘后扩大了损失;。< /p>;

;泛欧 STOXX 600 指数;(.STOXX); 下跌0.36%，MSCI 全球股票指数 ;(.MIWD00000PUS); 下跌 0.09%。

;

;

;美元 ;兑一篮子世界货币小幅走低;在中东局势不断上演的背景下，市场参与者为央行官员的讲话做好准备。

;

;一名男子涉嫌;一名45岁的突尼斯人在布鲁塞尔开枪打死;两名瑞典球迷并打伤另一名球迷，他在2020年的庇护申请被拒绝，但仍继续居住在布鲁塞尔据比利时官员称，比利时非法。

;

;经过连夜搜捕，警方;周二上午，犯罪嫌疑人在布鲁塞尔北部斯哈尔贝克区的一家咖啡馆被枪杀，一天后，检察官将其视为恐怖主义行为。

;

;当局尚未透露该男子的姓名。

;

;在一段声称对此次袭击负责的视频中，他称自己是伊斯兰国激进组织的成员，并自称阿卜杜萨利姆·阿尔·吉拉尼 (Abdesalem Al Guilani)。比利时国家广播公司 RTBF 将他命名为阿布德萨利姆·拉苏德 (Abdesalem Lassoued)。

;

;周二早上，在斯哈尔贝克的黄砖公寓楼里，俯瞰嫌疑人居住的一个小公园，身着制服的警察站岗，调查人员则在里面搜查证据。<邻居们称，嫌疑人与伴侣及其女儿住在一楼以上的一套公寓里。据一位不愿透露姓名的邻居透露，这名合伙人在一家女性美发沙龙工作。

;

;“他是那种你会打招呼的人，但也仅此而已。他总是对自己保持沉默。” “他本人，”一名站在嫌疑人楼上公寓被警察砸开的门对面的女士说道。

;

;“他很有礼貌，没有迹象表明可能会发生这样的事情，”一名男性邻居说。

;

;在周二早些时候的新闻发布会上，当警方搜寻嫌疑人时，比利时司法部长文森特·范奎肯伯恩表示，警方认识该男子，并涉嫌犯有人口贩运和非法居留等罪行。

;

; >;

;范·奎肯伯恩 (Van Quickenborne) 表示，2016 年，外国警察部门传递了一份未经证实的报告，称该男子具有“激进特征”，并希望前往战区发动圣战。

;

;但他表示“没有具体迹象”表明该男子在比利时安全部门认识时已变得激进，因此他不在任何观察名单上。

;

;在他的庇护申请被拒绝后2020 年 10 月，比利时当局称他“从雷达上消失了”。

;

;枪击事件发生之际，欧洲大部分地区与 ;以色列与哈马斯冲突;。

;

;今年，比利时当局收到举报，称该男子在突尼斯被判犯有恐怖主义罪范奎肯伯恩说，但事实证明该信息是假的，因为该男子仅被判犯有普通法罪行。

;

;尽管如此，显然出于谨慎考虑，安全部门还是召开了一次会议来讨论他的案件部长说。

;

;会议原定于周二举行，当天他被警察开枪打死。

; Tue, 17 Oct 2023 22:55:02 +0800 US manufacturing output rises solidly in Septemberhttps://reuters.com/article/usa-economy-manufacturing/us-manufacturing-output-rises-solidly-in-september-idUSKBN31H1GW
;;2023-10-17T13:57:06Z;
;;
;;2022 年 4 月 11 日，美国伊利诺伊州诺莫尔市初创公司 Rivian Automotive 电动汽车工厂的员工在装配线上工作。照片摄于 4 月 11 日，2022 年。 REUTERS/Kamil Krzaczynski/档案照片;
;

;尽管汽车行业罢工限制了机动车产量，但美国工厂 9 月份的产量增长超出预期，进一步证明经济退出了第三季度美联储周二表示，上个月制造业产出增长 0.4%。 8 月份数据被下调，显示工厂产量下降 0.1%，而不是之前报道的微升 0.1%。路透社调查的经济学家此前预测工厂产量将增长 0.1%。

;

;9 月份产量同比下降 0.8%。第三季度没有变化。耐用品制造业产出年化增长 2.3%，但被非耐用品制造业 2.4% 的下降速度所抵消。

;

;机动车及零部件产出继 8 月份下降 4.1% 后，上个月增长 0.3%。

;

;汽车工人联合会 (UAW) 对通用汽车旗下的工厂进行了有限罢工 ;(GM.N);、福特 ;(FN); 和克莱斯勒母公司 Stellantis ;(STLAM.MI); 于 9 月中旬。此后，罢工行动范围不断扩大，关闭了福特位于 ;肯塔基州;上周。

;

;尽管上个月表现强劲，但由于利率上升，制造业仍然受到商品需求放缓的限制。自2022年3月以来，美联储已将基准隔夜利率上调525个基点，至目前的5.25%-5.50%区间。

;

;制造业占经济的11.1%。但该行业最糟糕的时期可能已经过去，供应管理协会的措施;9月份全国;工厂活动升至10个月高点。

;

;上个月，木材、初级金属、塑料和橡胶产品的产量稳步增长。但服装和皮革以及印刷和辅助产品的产量下降。

;

;采矿业产出继 8 月份增长 0.2% 后增长 0.4%。公用事业产量继上月增长 0.7% 后下降 0.3%。继 8 月份持平后，9 月份整体工业生产增长 0.3%。

;

;第三季度工业产出增长 2.5%。第二季度增长 0.7%。

;

;9 月份工业部门的产能利用率（衡量企业充分利用资源的程度）上升了 0.2 个百分点，达到 79.7%。目前已等于 1972 年至 2022 年的平均水平。制造业开工率从上月的77.7%微升至77.8%，比长期平均水平低0.4个百分点。

; Tue, 17 Oct 2023 22:25:03 +0800 U.S. home builder confidence falls to lowest since Januaryhttps://reuters.com/article/usa-economy-housing/u-s-home-builder-confidence-falls-to-lowest-since-january-idUSKBN31H1H9

;;5 月 5 日，美国佛罗里达州坦帕市，一名木匠正在建造仍在建设中的新联排别墅，而建筑材料供应需求量很大，2021 年。路透社/奥克塔维奥·琼斯/档案照片;
;

;周二发布的一份报告显示，10 月份房屋建筑商信心跌至 1 月份以来的最低水平，表明极高的抵押贷款利率正在给建筑业带来压力坚定的乐观情绪和潜在买家流量。

;

;全国住宅建筑商协会 (NAHB)/富国银行报告称，信心指数从 9 月份修正后的 44 跌至 40，连续第三个月下跌。该数字也低于路透调查显示的经济学家对 44 不变的预期。

;

;“建筑商报告称，买家流量较低，因为一些买家，尤其是年轻买家，因价格过高而被挤出市场。 NAHB 主席 Alicia Huey 表示。 “较高的利率还增加了建筑商开发和建设贷款的成本和可用性，这损害了供应，并导致住房负担能力下降。”

;

;建筑商信心在八月份开始下滑，同月住房贷款利率下降达到7%以上。在美联储加息的背景下，抵押贷款利率自去年以来稳步上升，目前维持在二十年来的高位。

;

;由于高利率抑制了新房需求，2023 年上半年新房需求得到提振房主不再出售房屋，限制库存并提高新建筑的吸引力。买家流量在 7 月份达到峰值 40 人，10 月份降至 26 人，为 1 月份以来的最低水平。

;

;建筑商本月再次大幅降价，以提高买家的承受能力并促进销售，其中 32% 的建筑商降价十月份的价格。另一个追踪当前销售状况的指数下跌 4 点至 46，六个月销售前景从上个月的 49 跌至 44。

; Tue, 17 Oct 2023 22:25:03 +0800 US House to vote on Republican Jim Jordan“s bid for speakerhttps://reuters.com/article/usa-congress-speaker/us-house-to-vote-on-republican-jim-jordans-bid-for-speaker-idUSKBN31H0WL
;;2023-10-17T14:12:23Z;
;;
;;正在竞选众议院议长职位的美国众议员吉姆·乔丹 (R-OH) 在会议后向媒体发表讲话众议院共和党人继续试图在华盛顿国会山选举一位新议长。 REUTERS/Evelyn Hockstein;
;

;共和党;吉姆·乔丹;将在周二的投票中尝试夺取美国众议院议长的席位，这可能会将这位好斗的右翼人物提升为华盛顿最有权势的职位之一。< /p>;

;当众议院于美国东部时间中午（格林威治标准时间 1600 点）召开会议填补空缺两周的领导职位时，这位多年来与本党领导人斗争的俄亥俄州议员最终可能会获得一个职位这使他成为总统候选人的第二顺位候选人。

;

;乔丹一直在获得共和党同僚的支持，但周二上午似乎仍达不到他赢得总统职位所需的 217 票。< /p>;

;“走进会议时我感觉很好；现在感觉更好，”59 岁的乔丹在周一晚上与众议院共和党人会面两个小时后告诉记者。

;

;自 ;凯文·麦卡锡;被一小群人驱逐为发言人10 月 3 日，他的共和党同僚们表示，党派内斗导致众议院无法解决;紧迫问题;，例如对以色列和乌克兰的支持以及对美国政府的资助。

;

;乔丹是极右翼众议院自由核心小组的创始人，他的职业生涯大部分时间都在关注被视为国会山的分裂力量，与共和党和民主党纠缠不休。尽管如此，他上周五赢得了共和党议长提名，并;巩固党内前对手的支持。

;

;共和党以 221 比 212 的微弱优势控制众议院，预计所有民主党人都会投票反对他。预计至少有 7 名共和党人将投票反对乔丹，这将使他无法获得所需的 217 票。

;

;乔丹周二获得了至少一名议员的支持，而该议员此前对他的竞选不置可否。

;

;“人民院需要立即恢复工作。今天，当我们投票选举一位议长返回立法事务时，我将投票给@Jim_Jordan，”众议员胡安·思科马尼 (Juan Ciscomani) 在 X 上说道。

;

;如果乔丹一开始没有成功，预计他将举行多轮投票，以迫使共和党顽固分子就范。 1 月份也出现了类似的动态，当时麦卡锡需要 15 轮投票才能赢得议长的木槌。

;

;乔丹的盟友也敦促保守派选民向他的对手施压。

;

;“我的办公室纽约共和党众议员马克·莫利纳罗 (Marc Molinaro) 表示：“乔丹的支持者表示，他将成为削减开支和其他政策的有效倡导者。”共和党在与民主党总统乔·拜登和同样由民主党控制的参议院谈判时优先考虑。

;

;“吉姆是一个强硬的人，几乎要通过美国来推行我们的保守派议程，”共和党众议员马克说。奥尔福德。

;

;民主党人对乔丹的候选资格感到反感，将他描绘成一个听从前总统唐纳德·特朗普命令的极端分子。

;

;“他的议程很简单：按照特朗普的指示将堕胎定为犯罪。 ，削减社会保障和医疗保险，削弱民主，”民主党代表特德·刘在社交媒体上写道。

;

;乔丹在担任这项职务时的角度与国会其他领导人截然不同，后者通常通过提高影响力来发挥影响力金钱并保持政党团结。

;

;乔丹是保守派媒体的常客，他放大了特朗普关于 2020 年选举舞弊的虚假指控。作为众议院司法委员会主席，他正在帮助领导对拜登的弹劾调查。民主党人谴责其毫无根据。

;

;他帮助成立了众议院自由核心小组，时任议长约翰·博纳 (John Boehner) 称该小组为“立法恐怖分子”，之后该小组成员向他施压要求其退休。乔丹是 2013 年和 2018 年政府关闭的策划者。

;

;乔丹与麦卡锡的关系更为富有成效，麦卡锡是被一小群共和党叛乱分子赶下台的。

;

;共和党提名< href="/world/us/republican-steve-scalise-path-us-house-speaker-turbulent-time-2023-10-11/">;史蒂夫·斯卡利斯;上周接替麦卡锡，但他放弃了在他无法巩固支持后，他的竞选被一些共和党人归咎于乔丹和他的支持者。

;

;“我们已经让多数人中的少数人决定了我们所有人，这是不可接受的，”说众议员唐·培根 (Don Bacon) 计划投票反对乔丹。

;

;如果乔丹竞选议长的努力陷入停滞，共和党竞争对手已经确定了几位替代候选人，包括众议院第三号共和党人汤姆·埃默 (Tom Emmer) 和主持会议的代理议长帕特里克·麦克亨利 (Patrick McHenry)在议长选举中。

;

;在进入政界之前，乔丹曾在俄亥俄州立大学担任摔跤教练。 2018年，这段过去威胁到了他的政治生涯，当时的前学生指责他对乔丹担任助理教练时摔跤队医生对大学摔跤手进行猖獗的性虐待行为视而不见。

;

;乔丹否认了所有指控，大学调查没有发现确凿的证据表明他知道虐待行为。

; Tue, 17 Oct 2023 22:25:03 +0800 Venezuela, opposition to sign election deal, paving way for US sanctions reliefhttps://reuters.com/article/venezuela-politics-talks/venezuela-opposition-to-sign-election-deal-paving-way-for-us-sanctions-relief-idUSKBN31H1HY
;;2023-10-17T14:13:05Z;
;;
;;2023 年 6 月 12 日，委内瑞拉总统尼古拉斯·马杜罗在委内瑞拉加拉加斯米拉弗洛雷斯宫与伊朗总统易卜拉欣·莱西会面时发表讲话。 路透社/Leonardo Fernandez Viloria/档案照片;
;

;委内瑞拉总统尼古拉斯·马杜罗政府将于周二与该国反对派签署一项协议，这可能为缓解石油相关问题铺平道路 ;美国制裁;以换取举行自由和公平的2024年的承诺总统选举。

;

;美国长期以来一直表示将取消部分制裁，以换取委内瑞拉社会主义总统的民主让步。

;

;周二政府和反对派在巴巴多斯举行的会议标志着这是他们 11 个月来的第一次。此次会谈旨在为委内瑞拉长期的政治和经济危机提供一条出路，就在反对派将于周日举行初选以选择 2024 年总统候选人的几天前举行。

;

;马杜罗、自2013年以来担任总统，预计将竞选连任，但尚未正式确定其候选资格。他的政府已禁止知名反对派人物参选。

;

;如果政府和反对派之间达成的预期协议在华盛顿获得通过，美国总统乔·拜登政府预计将宣布;limited but significant; easing of sanctions, according to US sources.

;

; The US sources, however, have said any sanctions relief would be reversible if Maduro fails to meet his election commitments. Oil revenues are central to OPEC member Venezuela's economy.

;

;Reuters reported last week that Venezuela and the United States had progressed at their own talks in Qatar ;toward a deal; that could allow at least one additional foreign oil firm to take Venezuelan crude oil for debt repayment if Maduro resumed negotiations with the opposition.

;

;Maduro said late on Monday his government and the opposition would sign a deal he said would be beneficial for a 2024 election, though he offered no further details.

;

;Sources have told Reuters the deal will include an election date in the latter half of next year and allow the participation of opposition figures currently barred from holding office, among other things. It remained unclear whether all opposition candidates would have their bans lifted.

;

;At least ;two candidates; who initially had been set to run in the primary have bowed out because they are banned. Frontrunner Maria Corina Machado, who is also barred, remains in the race.

;

;The opposition considers the bans unlawful, and Washington has rejected any roadblocks to opposition candidates in the election. Some members of the opposition said on Monday that they ;doubted; Maduro would follow through on his promises.

;

;The United States imposed sanctions on Venezuela to punish Maduro's government following a 2018 election that Washington considered a sham. Since 2019, US sanctions have banned PDVSA from exporting its oil to its chosen markets.

;

;Donald Trump appeared in New York court on Tuesday for the third week of a civil fraud trial that ;could dismantle; pillars of the former US president's business empire.

;

;Trump, frontrunner for the 2024 Republican presidential nomination, arrived fresh off a Monday campaign stop in Iowa and after a weeklong absence from the trial centering on allegations that he inflated his net worth to secure more favorable loan terms.

;

;"This is a rigged trial," Trump told reporters outside the courtroom. Dressed in a dark blue suit and wearing an American flag pin on his lapel, Trump lashed out at the Biden administration and repeated his claim that the case amounted to a political witchhunt.

;

;A real estate appraiser involved in valuing Trump's 40 Wall Street property is expected to testify on Tuesday, along with a Trump Organization accountant involved in the company's internal bookkeeping practices.

;

;The lawsuit by Democratic New York Attorney General Letitia James alleges Trump ;reaped hundreds of millions of dollars; in ill-gotten savings by overstating the value of his properties in documents he provided to banks.

;

;Trump has denied wrongdoing and defended the valuations of his properties, saying the case is a "fraud" and attacking both James and the judge overseeing the case.

;

;Trump told reporters outside the courtroom that the true values of his assets including his Mar-a-Lago resort in Palm Beach, Florida were “close to 100 times” what James' office claimed.

;

;“The actual worth is much more than that, so therefore there's no fraud,” he said.

;

;Trump's former lawyer Michael Cohen, a star witness in the case, is expected to testify next week.

;

;The judge, Justice Arthur Engoron, found in September that Trump had engaged in fraud and ordered the dissolution of companies that control crown jewels of his real estate portfolio, including Trump Tower in Manhattan.在特朗普上诉期间，该裁决被搁置。

;

;审判主要涉及损害赔偿。 James is seeking at least $250 million in fines, a permanent ban against Trump and his sons Donald Jr and Eric from running businesses in New York and a five-year commercial real estate ban against Trump and the Trump Organization.

;

;Engoron ;imposed a gag order on Trump; after the former president attacked a court clerk in a post on his Truth Social platform. The gag order bars Trump from speaking publicly about court staff.

; Tue, 17 Oct 2023 22:25:03 +0800 What is the Rafah border crossing and why is it closed?https://reuters.com/article/israel-palestinians-egypt-rafah/explainer-why-gazas-rafah-border-crossing-matters-and-why-egypt-is-keeping-it-shut-idUSKBN31H1IK
;;2023-10-17T14:23:22Z;
;;
;;A Palestinian with dual citizenship waits outside the Rafah border crossing with Egypt in the hope of getting permission to leave Gaza, amid the ongoing Israeli-Palestinian conflict, in Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip October 17, 2023. REUTERS/Ibraheem Abu Mustafa ;
;

;The Rafah crossing between the Gaza Strip and Egypt is the sole route for aid to enter Gaza directly from outside Israel and the only exit that does not lead to Israeli territory.

;

;It has become a focus in the intensifying ;conflict; between Israel and the Palestinian militant group Hamas, as hundreds of thousands of Palestinians have headed towards south Gaza after Israel warned them to leave Gaza City and the enclave's north.

;

;The crossing is at the south of the Gaza Strip, a narrow slither of land that is home to 2.3 million people and wedged between Israel, Egypt and the Mediterranean Sea.

;

;The crossing is controlled by Egypt.

;

;In response to a devastating cross-border infiltration by Hamas fighters on Oct. 7 that killed over 1,300 Israelis, Israel has imposed a "total blockade" of Gaza, cutting off electricity to the territory and stopping all supplies of food and fuel.

;

;That means the only likely route for humanitarian aid to enter Gaza is via Rafah from Egypt's Sinai region. It is also the only exit point for Gaza residents seeking to flee.

;

;Foreign passport holders are expected to be allowed out under any deal to reopen the crossing, and have therefore headed in recent days to the vicinity, seeking to exit.

;

;Israel has also ;called on; Gazans to move southwards closer to Rafah to shelter from bombardment, although residents say they cannot find safety anywhere in the crowded enclave.

;

;Egypt is wary of insecurity near the border with Gaza in northeastern Sinai, where it faced an Islamist insurgency that peaked after 2013 and has now largely ;been suppressed;.

;

;Since Hamas took control in Gaza in 2007, Egypt has helped enforce a blockade of the enclave and heavily restricted the flow of people and goods. Like the main crossings with Israel, restrictions have sometimes been eased but not lifted, and travellers need security clearance and lengthy checks to pass.

;

;In 2008, tens of thousands of Palestinians crossed into Sinai after Hamas blasted holes in border fortifications, prompting Egypt to build a stone and cement wall.

;

;Egypt has acted as a mediator between Israel and Palestinian factions during past conflicts and periods of unrest. But in those situations it has also locked down the border, allowing aid to enter and medical evacuees to leave but preventing any large-scale movement of people.

;

;Even as Israel pursues its heaviest and most unrelenting bombardment of Gaza in response to the Hamas assault, Egypt has shown no sign so far that its approach will change. More than 2,800 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli bombing strikes.

;

;The United Nations has urged Israel to avert a "humanitarian catastrophe" in Gaza, warning that food, fuel and even drinking water supplies are running dangerously low.

;

;Hospitals say they are struggling to cope with the wounded as back-up generators run low on fuel.

;

;Egyptian aid ;trucks; moved closer to the crossing on Tuesday but it was unclear when or whether they would be able to cross into Gaza.

;

;US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Tuesday the United States and Israel had agreed to develop a plan to get humanitarian aid to civilians in Gaza without benefiting Hamas.

;

;;Arab countries; have deep-rooted fears that Israel's latest war with Hamas in Gaza could spark a new wave of permanent displacement from land where Palestinians want to build a state.

;

;Egypt, the only Arab state to share a border with Gaza, and Jordan, which flanks the Israeli-occupied West Bank, have both warned against Palestinians being forced off their land.

;

;Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi has said it is vital that Palestinians "remain steadfast and present on their land," while Jordan's King Abdullah warned "against any attempt to forcibly displace Palestinians from all Palestinian territories or cause their internal displacement".

;

;For Arabs and Palestinians, the idea of leaving or being driven out of territory where they want to forge a state carries echoes of the ";Nakba;", or "catastrophe", when many Palestinians fled or were forced from their homes during the 1948 war that accompanied Israel's creation.

;

;Israel contests the assertion it drove Palestinians out, saying it was attacked by five Arab states after its creation.

;

;Some 700,000 Palestinians, half the Arab population of what was British-ruled Palestine, were dispossessed and displaced, many spilling into neighbouring Arab states where they and their descendants remain. Many still live in refugee camps.

;

;As a result, many Palestinians say they do not want to leave Gaza - from which Israel withdrew in 2005 after a 38-year occupation - even as this latest conflict has escalated.
